episodes.title: Starve the Babies: Nikale's Viral Social Experiment is Exposing Churches | Exvangelical Deep Dive
episodes.description:
When TikToker Nikale started calling local churches pretending to be a struggling mom in need of baby formula, she wasn’t trying to start drama — she was running a social experiment. The goal? To see how many churches would actually help a mother in crisis. The results were shocking. This video dives into what her experiment revealed about Christian charity, church priorities, and the gap between faith and action. From the viral TikToks to the wider conversation about religious hypocrisy, poverty, and community care, this deep dive breaks down why Nikale’s calls hit such a nerve online — and what they say about the modern church’s response to real human need.

#churchhurt #deconstruction #deconstructionjourney #religioustrauma #religiousabuse #christiantiktok

episodes.title: From Light Worker to Killer: Deep Dive Samantha Booth | Viral TikTok Spiritual Guru and True Crime
episodes.description:
Samantha Booth built a following online as a self-proclaimed light worker and spiritual healer — posting about energy cleansing, manifestation, and divine love. But behind the aesthetic filters and affirmations, a much darker story was unfolding.

In this long-form deep dive, we explore how Samantha Booth went from viral TikTok spiritual guru to accused killer. Through her videos, social media posts, and the online communities that amplified her, this documentary uncovers the dangerous intersection of toxic spirituality, parasocial influence, and self-delusion.

We’ll cover:
- The rise of “light worker” culture on TikTok and New Age influencer trends
- How Booth used spirituality to justify erratic and harmful behavior
- The psychological patterns behind spiritual narcissism
- The line between belief, performance, and manipulation
- And what her story reveals about the dark side of social media spirituality

This video blends true crime analysis with cultural commentary — examining how viral fame, spiritual rhetoric, and mental health collided in one of the most disturbing influencer cases to ever hit TikTok.

#truecrimestories #newage  #samanthabooth #tiktokviral

episodes.title: The Price of Christian Womanhood | Exvangelical Documentary on Religious Abuse & Religious Authority
episodes.description:
What does it really cost to be a “good Christian woman”?

This long-form Exvangelical documentary explores the hidden pressures placed on Christian wives and mothers within conservative and evangelical church culture. From purity culture and marital expectations to motherhood, submission, and spiritual abuse, this video breaks down how religious authority and gender roles have shaped—and often harmed—Christian women’s lives.

We’ll look at:
- How purity culture affects women’s sexual health and marital satisfaction
- The emotional and financial traps of stay-at-home motherhood
- The “Proverbs 31” ideal and impossible standards of godly womanhood
- The ways religious authority is used to silence women’s pain

Why deconstruction often begins with women asking, “Is this really what God wants for me?”

This video is part of a larger conversation about deconstruction, feminism, and faith reconstruction within evangelical spaces. Whether you’re deconstructing your own beliefs or trying to understand how church culture shapes gender, this deep dive offers compassion, clarity, and context.

#religiousabuse #religioustrauma #spiritualabuse #fundiesnark #documentary #girldefined #christiannationalism

This deep dive unpacks the hidden side of her life, the influence of religious culture, and the quiet danger of normalizing medical neglect online.

episodes.title: Life and Death of Dr. James Dobson: A Full Deep Dive | Exvangelical
episodes.description:
The Life and Death of Dr. James Dobson: Dr. James Dobson is arguably one of the most influential figures in modern American Christianity. Dobson is the founder of Focus on the Family, an advisor to U.S. presidents, and a key component in the formation of the Religious Right. His legacy reaches far beyond parenting advice or Christian radio and the harms are great. His teachings truly shaped evangelical culture. Eventually, it also shaped politics, gender roles, and family life.

In this documentary, we deep-dive into Dobson’s life, what he built, and the ways his ideology influenced millions of evangelicals and impacted American politics. From over-the-top discipline and “family values” to political efforts and his recent work through the Dr. James Dobson Family Institute, we’ll cover both the life and death of Dr. James Dobson.

BOOKS Mentioned: 
Jesus and John Wayne: https://amzn.to/4lDYDnA
The Kingdom, The Power and The Glory: https://amzn.to/3HE8pbg

#jamesdobson #exvangelical #deconstruction #religioustrauma #dobson #deepdive #documentary

Modern "Christian" dating advice is everywhere—but is it healthy, biblical, or even helpful? In this eye-opening reaction video, I dive into some of the most popular (and problematic) dating advice circulating in evangelical spaces today. Spoiler: it’s worse than I thought.

As someone who’s walked away from toxic theology, I break down how purity culture, control, and shame still shape Christian dating narratives—and why it’s time to rethink the whole system.

#religioustrauma #exvangelical #deconstruction #evangelicalism

episodes.title: Paul and Morgan’s Health Crisis: Faith, Neglect, or Something Worse?
episodes.description:
Paul and Morgan have built a platform around Christian lifestyle content—but Morgan’s recent health collapse has revealed something darker. As she deteriorates on camera, her husband’s focus on prayer over treatment reflects a disturbing trend in evangelical culture.

Is this what spiritual leadership looks like? Or is it something more dangerous?

In this deep dive, we examine faith, suffering, medical neglect, and why evangelicalism so often fails to care for its sick.

#exvangelical #deconstruction #religioustrauma

episodes.title: Modesty to Money: The Truth About Girl Defined’s Christian Brand
episodes.description:
I grew up in evangelical culture—Bible studies, purity pledges, modesty rules—the whole thing. So when I say I get Girl Defined, I really do. In this video, we’re taking a deep dive into the world of Bethany and Kristen: their books, their courses, their brand—and the real harm caused when unqualified influencers offer advice on sex, marriage, mental health, and womanhood.

This isn’t just a takedown—it's a compassionate critique of a system that taught us to idolize biblical womanhood while ignoring actual expertise. From their infamous “sex and intimacy” course to the deeply flawed theology they sell in books and conferences, we’re unpacking how Girl Defined became one of the most recognizable—and damaging—faces of Christian girlhood online.

If you’ve ever felt confused, ashamed, or not "biblical enough" because of content like this... you're not alone.

#girldefined #exvangelical #deconstruction

episodes.title: Jordan Peterson's Legacy: A Critical Analysis
episodes.description:
Jordan Peterson has become one of the most polarizing intellectuals of our time—hailed as a truth-teller by some and criticized as a cultural reactionary by others. In this video, we take a critical look at Peterson’s legacy: his influence on politics, religion, masculinity, and mental health.

This is not a hit piece or blind praise—just an honest examination of a public figure whose ideas have shaped a generation’s thinking, for better or worse.

#jordanpeterson  #exvangelical  #deconstruction  #masculinity  #christiannationalism  #religioustrauma   #culturewars

episodes.title: Deep Dive on Princess Treatment & Gender Norms | Exvangelical Perspective
episodes.description:
Today we’re unpacking the viral world of “Princess Treatment” through the lens of TikTok influencer Courtney Palmer (aka “Princess Collarbone”) — but this isn’t just a reaction video. From Mormon roots to collarbone pops, we’ll explore what her content reveals about femininity, religious gender roles, and the pull of nostalgic womanhood.

As someone who grew up evangelical and now speaks from an exvangelical perspective, I’m bringing nuance, not snark. We’re talking about why this trend resonates with so many, how it mirrors purity culture and patriarchal structures, and what a healthier vision of softness, agency, and femininity might look like.

#exvangelical #deconstruction

episodes.title: The Truth Behind The Viral “Ex-Gay” Christian TikToker GRIFFIN | Exvangelical Deep Dive
episodes.description:
Griffin's videos have gone viral — emotional testimonies about leaving behind his "gay lifestyle" to follow Jesus. If you've seen him on your feed, you might’ve had a strong reaction: confusion, heartbreak, maybe even anger or mockery. But this video is not about piling on.

As someone who grew up immersed in evangelical culture — purity rings, revival nights, Bible drills, the works — and who’s since deconstructed my faith, I recognize the language Griffin is using. I recognize the desperation underneath the declarations. And I know exactly how intoxicating it can feel to think you’ve finally “fixed” the part of yourself you were taught to hate.

In this longform video, we’re going to sit with the complexity of Griffin’s journey. We'll look at how evangelicalism rewards dramatic “conversion testimonies,” how ex-gay narratives survive and thrive on platforms like TikTok, and how spiritual repression gets mislabeled as healing.

#religioustrauma #exvangelical #spiritualabuse

episodes.title: Charlie Kirk on Feminism: Why the Christian Right Gets It So Wrong | Exvangelical Reacts
episodes.description:
Charlie Kirk has a lot to say about feminism—but is it rooted in truth, or in fear? In this video, I respond to a recent segment where Kirk critiques modern feminism through a conservative Christian lens. As someone who has left evangelicalism, I break down the theology, the cultural narratives, and the manipulation behind this rhetoric.

Let me know your thoughts in the comments. Have you heard this type of messaging in your church or community?

#exvangelical  #charliekirk  #feminism  #christiannationalism  #deconstruction  #biblicalwomanhood  #religioustrauma  #churchhurt

episodes.title: Reclaiming Your Narrative: Beyond Church Hurt
episodes.description:
Have you ever felt wounded by the very place that was supposed to heal you? In this honest and healing conversation, we explore the real experiences of church hurt—what it is, how it impacts our faith, and how to move forward without losing ourselves or our connection to God.

Whether you're in the middle of your healing journey or just beginning to unpack the pain, this video offers tools, stories, and encouragement to help you reclaim your voice and your faith on your own terms.

#exvangelical #churchhurt #religioustrauma #deconstruction #spiritualabuse

episodes.title: Escaping Dwell Community Church (Xenos): FULL INTERVIEW
episodes.description:
In this powerful full-length interview, we sit down with a former member of Dwell Community Church, formerly known as Xenos Christian Fellowship, to uncover the experiences, inner workings, and difficult journey of leaving what many have called a high-control religious group.

From communal living and spiritual manipulation to the personal toll of cutting ties, this interview sheds light on the hidden dynamics behind the scenes of Dwell/Xenos. Whether you're researching the group, healing from religious trauma, or simply seeking understanding, this unfiltered conversation offers crucial insight.

GUEST INFO: 
Niddy is a voice in what could be considered an "Atheosphere" on YouTube. On his channel, he does his hot takes on Christian content and some live interviews with believers and non-believers.  You can catch him in a lot of live chats moderating some of his favorite channels. You can even catch him live with Biblical scholar Kipp Davis on their show Budget Scripture Saturday. 

YouTube link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U0Ie3gJoF6M 

#religioustrauma #exvangelical #deconstruction #spiritualabuse #dwell #xenos #cult

episodes.title: The Truth About Dwell (Formerly Xenos): Ohio's Still-Active Church Cult
episodes.description:
Dwell Community Church—formerly known as Xenos Christian Fellowship—is one of the most controversial religious groups in the United States. Based in Columbus, Ohio, this non-denominational megachurch has been called everything from a tight-knit Christian community to a high-control cult. In this video, we take a deep, honest, and compassionate look at why so many former members are speaking out.

We’ll explore:
- The history of Xenos/Dwell
- How the house church model became a system of control
- Patterns of spiritual abuse, authoritarian leadership, and emotional manipulation
- Why leaving Dwell is so difficult—and what happens after you do
- How online survivor communities are helping people heal
- The truth behind Dwell’s rebrand from Xenos in 2020

Whether you’re a current member, a former member, or someone just curious about high-control religious groups, this video offers context, testimony, and insight into a system that has shaped—and in many cases, harmed—thousands of lives.

GUEST INFO: 
Niddy is a voice in what could be considered an "Atheosphere" on YouTube. On his channel, he does his hot takes on Christian content and some live interviews with believers and non-believers.  You can catch him in a lot of live chats moderating some of his favorite channels. You can even catch him live with Biblical scholar Kipp Davis on their show Budget Scripture Saturday. 

YouTube link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U0Ie3gJoF6M 

#xenos #dwell #xenosdwell #cults #modernculture #christiancult #spiritualabuse #spiritualmanipulation

episodes.title: My Deconstruction Story: Why I Left the Evangelical Christian Church
episodes.description:
In this video, I’m sharing my personal story of deconstructing my faith — how I went from being deeply involved in evangelical Christianity to identifying as agnostic.

I’ve gotten a lot of questions about why I’m no longer a Christian, what led me to question my beliefs, and what I believe now. I’ve hesitated to make a full video on this, but I finally feel ready to talk about it in a more complete and honest way.

#religioustrauma #deconstruction #deconstructingfaith #exvangelical

episodes.title: End-Times Panic: How Revelation Shaped a Generation’s Anxiety | Exvangelical Reacts
episodes.description:
What happens when your view of the future is built on fear?
In this video, I take a deep dive into how certain interpretations of Revelation—especially within modern evangelical circles—can lead to end-times panic, anxiety, and even religious trauma.

If you grew up fearing the Rapture, scanning the news for signs of the Antichrist, or wrestling with whether you were “ready,” you are not alone. We’ll explore the origins of these teachings, their psychological impact, and what it looks like to deconstruct those beliefs and move toward something healthier, more grounded, and more hopeful.

This isn’t about mocking faith—it’s about asking honest questions and creating space for healing.

#religioustrauma  #exvangelical #deconstruction #endtimes #endtimemassege #tribulation #rapture #religiousabuse

episodes.title: The Institute in Basic Life Principles (IBLP): How Bill Gothard’s Teachings Harmed a Generation
episodes.description:
What happens when fear is the foundation of your faith?

In this deep dive, we explore how the Institute in Basic Life Principles (IBLP) — founded by Bill Gothard — created a culture of fear, shame, and emotional suppression. From the infamous “umbrella of authority” to teachings that framed anxiety and depression as sin, the IBLP’s influence has left lasting scars on countless lives.

This isn’t just about strict rules or conservative values. It’s about spiritual bypassing, mental health denial, and a system that punished people — especially women and children — for being human. If you were raised in the IBLP, ATI, or adjacent purity culture movements, this video may hit close to home.

#IBLP #exvangelical  #religioustrauma  #Gothard #purityculture  #spiritualabuse  #fundamentalism  #deconstruction

episodes.title: A Ministry of Mental Healing: a Girls Gone Bible Case Study
episodes.description:
This video takes a critical look at how Girls Gone Bible—a popular Christian podcast hosted by ex-party girls turned faith influencers—discusses mental health. Are they offering support, or spiritualizing real psychological struggles?

- Through in-depth clips and commentary, we unpack:
- How Girls Gone Bible frames therapy, medication, and mental illness
- The tension between faith and psychology in evangelical spaces
- Dangerous narratives like “just pray it away” and “anxiety is sin”
- Why spiritualizing trauma can delay real healing

This isn’t just about a podcast. It’s about how influential Christian voices shape our understanding of mental health—and the harm that can come when therapy is framed as a lack of faith.

#GirlsGoneBible #Exvangelical #MentalHealthMatters #ReligiousTrauma #FaithAndMentalHealth #PurityCulture #ChristianInfluencers #Deconstruction #SpiritualBypassing #ToxicFaith #TherapyIsNotSin #MentalHealthAwareness #ChurchHurt #EvangelicalCulture #FaithVsTherapy

episodes.title: Biblical Submission: A Girls Gone Bible Case Study
episodes.description:
In this deep-dive, we explore the popular Christian podcast Girls Gone Bible and their controversial takes on relationships, dating, purity culture, gender roles, and cohabitation — all from an exvangelical perspective.

Angela Halili and Arielle Reitsma have built a massive platform guiding young women through faith-based living, but their teachings around intimacy, submission, and the "Godly man" have sparked real conversation — and critique.

As someone who has stepped away from evangelical culture, I examine how their advice impacts women emotionally, spiritually, and relationally — especially those coming out of purity culture or navigating faith deconstruction.

#GirlsGoneBible #Exvangelical #PurityCulture #ChristianDating #FaithDeconstruction #ChristianMarriage #ReligiousTrauma #DatingAdvice #FaithAndRelationships #GenderRoles #ChristianityExplained #EvangelicalCulture #DeconstructionJourney #ChristianInfluencers #ChristianTikTok

episodes.title: Genesis Isn’t What I Remembered | An Exvangelical Rereads the First Book of the Bible
episodes.description:
As an exvangelical, I was taught Genesis was the foundation of everything — creation, morality, family, gender, sin. But rereading it outside of a fundamentalist lens? It hits completely different.

This is not your typical Bible study. We’re talking divine favoritism, generational trauma, weird sibling drama, morally questionable “heroes,” and a God who feels… disturbingly human.

In this video, I share my raw, honest thoughts as I revisit Genesis after years of deconstruction. Spoiler: It's not about dinosaurs on a boat or six literal days. It’s about power, patriarchy, and the messiness of being human.

If you're rethinking your faith or untangling religious trauma, this one’s for you.

#Exvangelical #Deconstruction #Genesis #ReligiousTrauma #BibleStudyReimagined #ProgressiveChristianity #ExvangelicalTikTok #LeavingEvangelicalism #FaithDeconstruction #ChristianityUnpacked

episodes.title: The TikTok to Alt-Right Pipeline: Christian Nationalism is Infecting Gen Z
episodes.description:
Let’s talk about how a seemingly harmless algorithm turned TikTok into a subtle (and sometimes not-so-subtle) pipeline to far-right ideology. From "trad wife" aesthetics to Christian Nationalism-lite, the content feels wholesome—until it’s not. This video breaks down how the algorithm pushes young users toward alt-right talking points through aesthetics, humor, and "anti-woke" content disguised as common sense. If you're exvangelical or deconstructing, you've probably seen this play out.
This isn’t just about politics—it’s about power, control, and the stories we’re being fed.

#Exvangelical #AltRightPipeline #TikTokAlgorithm #TradWife #Deconstruction #ChristianNationalism #TikTokCultures #FarRightContent #DigitalRadicalization #YouthAndPolitics #ChristianRight #ExFundie #SocialMediaAwareness

episodes.title: The Moral Majority: How Evangelicals Took Over American Politics
episodes.description:
In this video, we’re digging into the rise of the Moral Majority, the political movement that forever changed the relationship between evangelicalism and American politics. If you've ever wondered how we got from Sunday School to culture wars, this is the origin story. We’ll break down how leaders like Jerry Falwell weaponized religion for political gain, the role of racism and segregation in mobilizing evangelicals, and how this 1980s movement still shapes everything from abortion debates to Christian Nationalism today.
Whether you're deconstructing, newly exvangelical, or just curious—this history matters.

#Exvangelical #ChristianNationalism #MoralMajority #Deconstruction #ChurchHistory #ReligiousRight #Evangelicalism #JerryFalwell #AmericanPolitics #ChristianityAndPolitics #ChristianRight

episodes.description:

By analyzing their teachings, scripture usage, and underlying messages, we explore the real-life impact this framework has on women—mentally, emotionally, and socially. Whether you're deconstructing your faith or just curious about how these ideologies shape Christian womanhood today, this video offers a critical yet thoughtful case study.

episodes.title: “Church Hurt”: The New Buzzword for Abuse
episodes.description:
“Church hurt” has become the Christian catch-all for anything from mild offense to deep trauma—but what happens when this phrase is used to minimize real abuse? In this video, I’m speaking from an exvangelical perspective about how the term church hurt has become a trendy buzzword that waters down the actual harm people experience in religious spaces.

This isn’t just about hurt feelings. It’s about power, control, spiritual manipulation, sexism, homophobia, and abuse—rebranded as a cute phrase churches can pray away.

If you’ve been dismissed, shamed, or told you just need to forgive and move on, this video is for you.

#ChurchHurt #Exvangelical #ReligiousTrauma #Deconstruction #SpiritualAbuse #Christianity #ToxicChurchCulture #ChurchAccountability #LeavingReligion #FaithDeconstruction

episodes.title: Why Christians Forgive Abuse too Fast: Michael Tait of the Newsboys Exposed
episodes.description:
In this video, we take a hard look at the recent controversy surrounding Michael Tait and what it reveals about the Christian community's pattern of rushing to forgive abuse—often at the expense of accountability and justice. When does grace become a cover-up? And why are survivors so often labeled as “gossips” for speaking up? This is an honest conversation from an exvangelical perspective about complicity, silence, and the cost of cheap grace.

#newsboys #michaeltait #christianmusic #religiousabuse #religioustrauma

episodes.title: Jadon Prayed the Gay Away Overnight... so maybe you can, too
episodes.description:
TikTok creator Jadon recently shared that they are now straight because of God — a message that's gaining traction across Christian and queer spaces. In this video, I respond with compassion and concern from an exvangelical perspective. I explore the deeper implications of ex-gay testimonies, the intersection of faith and identity, and why messages like this can be spiritually harmful — even when shared with sincerity. This isn't about attacking Jadon — it's about protecting those silently hurting.

If you've ever prayed to "fix" your sexuality or felt torn between your faith and your identity, this video is for you.

#TikTok #Exvangelical #Deconstruction #LGBTQ #FaithAndIdentity #Jadon #Christianity #ExGay #ReligiousTrauma #QueerChristian

episodes.title: A college campus cult: Chi Alpha's Shocking History and Concerning Future
episodes.description:
https://xalionsden.com/

Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship claims to be a student ministry, but behind the worship nights and Bible studies lies a culture of manipulation, control, and cult-like behavior.

In this in-depth exposé, I break down how Chi Alpha operates like a multi-level marketing scheme, pressures students into performative healing, and aggressively targets international students as part of a broader mission strategy.

Whether you’ve been involved in Chi Alpha or are just curious about what really goes on, this video pulls back the curtain on the inner workings of one of America’s most powerful campus ministries.

#ChiAlpha #ReligiousTrauma #ChristianCult #CampusMinistryExposed #SpiritualManipulation

This video offers a comprehensive deep dive into Teen Challenge of Oklahoma and its connection to the broader troubled teen industry. We examine the program's structure, practices, and claims of faith-based rehabilitation, alongside testimonies from former participants. As concerns grow about abuse, lack of regulation, and the mental health consequences of these programs, it's more important than ever to hold them accountable. She opens up about her time in the program, the impact it had on her mental health, and what life has looked like since leaving. episodes.title: Losing Your Religion in the Public Eye: A GIRL DEFINED Case Study
episodes.description:
What happens when the people who taught you how to follow Jesus start questioning the very faith they built their brand on? In this video, we dive into the story of Girl Defined — the Christian influencer sisters who rose to fame promoting biblical womanhood, only to later begin rethinking their beliefs in front of thousands of followers.

This case study explores what it looks like to lose (or evolve) your religion in the public eye, how online ministry creates a pressure cooker of identity and belief, and why so many in the Exvangelical community are watching this unfold with both empathy and caution.

#GirlDefined #Exvangelical #Deconstruction #PurityCulture #ReligiousTrauma

episodes.title: Surviving a Fundamentalist Childhood with Religious OCD | Interview
episodes.description:
What happens when you're visually impaired, queer, struggling with OCD and growing up in a fundamentalist Christian church? In this powerful interview, I speak to someone who lived that reality — navigating religious trauma, spiritual fear, and religious OCD in a world that saw their identity as something to be fixed.

They share what it was like to grow up in a Wesleyan Methodist community. We dive into how religious OCD developed, how internalized homophobia took root, and how they ultimately began to deconstruct, heal, and reclaim their story.

If you've ever wrestled with toxic theology, purity culture, Christian nationalism, or religious trauma — this conversation will resonate deeply.

#religiousocd #exvangelical #religion #deconstruction #lgbtq #fundamentalism #christiantrauma #lgbtqchristian #mentalhealth #religiousabuse

episodes.title: Charlie Kirk Proved My Point at the Cambridge Debate
episodes.description:
Charlie Kirk brought his usual firebrand Christian nationalism to the Cambridge Union in June 2025 — and as an exvangelical, I couldn’t stay silent. In this long-form response video, I unpack Kirk’s talking points on foreign policy, LGBTQ+ rights, race, religion, and more through the lens of someone who left the evangelical movement behind.

From misinformation about George Floyd to a theological defense of culture wars, this video breaks down the core narratives behind Turning Point USA’s brand of “faith and freedom.”

This isn’t just a political critique — it’s a personal one. If you’ve ever questioned the fusion of church and state, or felt like your faith couldn’t coexist with compassion and critical thinking, this response is for you.

#CharlieKirk #Exvangelical #CambridgeDebate #ChristianNationalism #FaithDeconstruction #TurningPointUSA #DebunkingCharlieKirk

episodes.title: How Girl Defined Demonizes Singleness (and Calls It Godly Advice)
episodes.description:
Let’s talk about how Girl Defined really views singleness—because it’s not just “a season” or “a gift,” no matter how many times they say it. Beneath the surface, their message is clear: if you're not married, you're spiritually incomplete, probably struggling, and definitely waiting for your "real purpose" to begin.

In this video, we dive into how Girl Defined subtly (and not-so-subtly) demonizes singleness, treats it like a trial to endure, and frames marriage as the ultimate goal of womanhood. Spoiler: singleness isn’t a curse, and your life isn’t on pause.

Let me know in the comments—have you noticed this messaging too?

#GirlDefined #Singleness #ChristianCulture #PurityCulture #Exvangelical

episodes.title: Faking a Faith to Manipulate Believers: Dr. Jordan B. Peterson
episodes.description:
Can someone fake faith to gain power over believers? In this powerful and thought-provoking clip, Dr. Jordan B. Peterson explores the dangers of feigned religiosity and the psychological tactics used by those who manipulate communities of faith for personal gain.

Drawing from his deep knowledge of psychology, theology, and human behavior, Dr. Peterson breaks down how belief systems can be twisted into tools of control—and why genuine faith requires more than just words.

Like, comment, and share your thoughts below—especially if you’ve ever witnessed spiritual manipulation firsthand.

#JordanPeterson #Faith #Manipulation #Belief #Religion #Psychology #Truth

episodes.title: Christian Nationalism: Using Spiritual Manipulation to Control a Party
episodes.description:
Christian nationalism is not Christianity. It’s a political ideology that uses religious language and imagery to manipulate people of faith into supporting authoritarian power. This video explores how Christian nationalism has taken hold in American politics, particularly within one party, by distorting scripture, exploiting fear, and blending religious identity with national identity.

From the perspective of an exvangelical who no longer identifies as religious, this is a personal and political reflection on how spiritual manipulation fuels Christian nationalism—and why that should concern everyone, regardless of belief. The rise of this movement threatens not only religious freedom but democracy itself, harming both believers and nonbelievers along the way.

This is not about attacking faith. It's about exposing the difference between genuine belief and political extremism wrapped in religious language. You don’t need to be religious to oppose Christian nationalism. You just need to care about truth, freedom, and human dignity.

#ChristianNationalism #Exvangelical #SeparationOfChurchAndState #ReligiousFreedom #Deconstruction #FaithAndPolitics #AmericanDemocracy #ReligiousTrauma #ChristianityAndPolitics

episodes.title: Purity Culture: A Deep Dive into Fear, Control and Identity
episodes.description:
In this in-depth exploration, we unravel the hidden layers of purity culture—a system rooted in fear, control, and the shaping of identity, especially for women and queer people. From modesty rules and abstinence pledges to shame-based teachings, we examine how purity culture has impacted generations mentally, emotionally, and spiritually.

Whether you grew up in evangelical spaces or are just curious about the long-term effects of this movement, this video offers insight, reflection, and real stories. We’ll also explore how individuals are reclaiming their bodies, autonomy, and sense of self in the aftermath.

#PurityCulture #Deconstruction #ReligiousTrauma #Identity #Christianity #Exvangelical #SexualShame

episodes.title: The Religious Monetization of Sexual Shame
episodes.description:
The evangelical church has spent decades turning m@sturbation, p*rn, and sexual thoughts into something they label as “addiction” — even when it doesn’t meet the clinical definition. In this deep-dive video, we unpack how purity culture distorts sexual development, how the church-created “porn addiction” industry thrives on fear, and how shame is weaponized to keep people dependent on church programs, conferences, and accountability groups.

We’ll explore:

What real addiction is (and isn’t)

The rise of purity culture and its lasting trauma

How tech filters, books, and counseling services created a billion-dollar evangelical niche

Why “freedom from lust” becomes a form of spiritual control

Personal stories from people hurt by these teachings

If you’ve ever been told your normal sexual urges are sinful, broken, or addictive — this video is for you.

#purityculture #exvangelical

episodes.title: Praying the Gay Away: A Paul & Morgan Case Study
episodes.description:
In this deep-dive video, we critically examine the Christian YouTubers Paul and Morgan and their messaging around LGBTQ+ identity, faith, and salvation. From their public critiques of queer artists like Lil Nas X to their commentary on Caitlyn Jenner’s hope of getting into heaven, this video unpacks how their brand of “biblical truth” contributes to spiritual trauma, exclusion, and misinformation.

As someone who grew up evangelical and now speaks from an exvangelical lens, I explore how Paul and Morgan’s rigid theology, political affiliations, and misunderstanding of LGBTQ+ people do real harm—especially to queer Christians trying to stay connected to their faith.

We cover:
👉 Their fundamentalist views and political alignment
👉 Misrepresentation of queer culture and identity
👉 Theological implications of their stance on salvation
👉 The real-world impact on LGBTQ+ youth, Christians, and deconstructing viewers
👉 Why this matters—and what a more loving, inclusive theology can look like

This isn’t a hit piece. It’s a conversation about empathy, accountability, and the cost of using God’s name to marginalize others.

⛪ Whether you’re deconstructing, queer, Christian, or just curious—this is for you.

episodes.description:
In this video, I take a closer look at two of Paul & Morgan’s videos where they discuss mental health from a Christian perspective—asking whether therapy is a crutch and if Christians should take antidepressants.

As someone who grew up evangelical and has since deconstructed, I’m breaking down the theology, the stigma, and the real-world impact of telling people to “just pray it away.”

episodes.title: Spiritual Abuse: A Paul & Morgan Case Study
episodes.description:
In this video, we explore how spiritual abuse can show up in Christian marriages—using public content from Christian influencer couple Paul and Morgan as a real-world case study.

Spiritual abuse is a form of manipulation where religion or scripture is used to control, shame, or dominate others. It can be difficult to recognize—especially when it’s wrapped in the language of faith, obedience, and submission.

This video is not a personal attack. It’s a critical look at how harmful dynamics can be hidden in plain sight, and how well-meaning teachings can cross the line into coercion. If you’ve ever felt spiritually manipulated or silenced in the name of God, this video may resonate deeply with you.

⛔ Topics covered:

What spiritual abuse looks like in marriage

Key red flags to watch for

Examples of coercive or manipulative language

The difference between leadership and control

Why recognizing abuse is hard in faith-based relationships

📚 Resources for support

The Hotline – National Domestic Abuse Support

FaithTrust Institute

Therapy for Religious Trauma (RIPR List)

👉 Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and share if you find this helpful. Awareness is the first step to healing.

#SpiritualAbuse #narcabuse #PaulAndMorgan #ReligiousTrauma #exchristian #domesticviolence

episodes.title: From Believer to Skeptic: Chloe’s Journey Out of Religion
episodes.description:
In this honest and powerful interview, Chloe shares her journey of growing up in a strict purity culture, marrying young, and later separating from her husband as she began to question the beliefs that shaped her identity.

We talk about:

The messages she received around sex, dating, and marriage

How purity culture influenced her self-worth and spiritual life

What it was like to deconstruct her faith and begin dating again

Her evolving relationship with Christianity and her body

What healing looks like — and what she would say to others on this path

They’ve gone viral for their wholesome content — and then infamous for the backlash.
With 40k+ followers on TikTok, the Daddy-Daughter Dream Team has faced online accusations questioning the nature of their relationship.

They’ve never spoken publicly — until now.

PLEASE NOTE that I remain neutral, letting them share their side for the first time. This was a requirement for the interview to take place. Please do not take my lack of opinion in this video as a neutral stance. I will do a separate reaction to the interview in which I will give my opinions.... but tbh, this one kinda speaks for itself. 

In this exclusive interview and deep dive, we unpack the controversy, the social media narrative, and finally, sit down with the duo for an honest, unfiltered conversation. 

🎙️ Full context. No interruptions. Just their story.
👇 Watch it all unfold.

#daddydaughterdreamteam #deepdive #documentary #interview

episodes.title: Religious OCD on TikTok? The Dangers of Faith-Based Obsessive Thoughts
episodes.description:
Religious OCD is REAL, and TikTok is filled with content that both normalizes and complicates the struggles of trying to manage faith and obsessive thoughts. In this video, I'm reacting to some of the most intense religious OCD TikToks and breaking down how harmful these "spiritual" rules can be to mental health.

🧠 Why does the church make people with OCD feel like they're failing God?
💥 How purity culture and extreme religious teachings worsen obsessive-compulsive thoughts
🤯 Is the TikTok approach to "faith-based OCD" helpful… or harmful?

If you’ve struggled with intrusive thoughts tied to faith, this video might hit close to home. Let’s talk about how we can heal from this toxic mix of anxiety and religion, and reclaim our peace.

👇 Have you experienced religious OCD? Share your story in the comments — you're not alone.
🔔 Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and hit the bell to stay up-to-date with all my deconstruction, mental health, and faith recovery content.

#ReligiousOCD #FaithAndMentalHealth #Exvangelical #OCDandReligion #PurityCulture #FaithDeconstruction #MentalHealthAwareness #IntrusiveThoughts #ReligiousTrauma #DeconstructingFaith #ChristianTikTok #OCDRecovery

episodes.title: Life is PERFECT for Paul & Morgan (unless you ask literally anyone else)
episodes.description:
...unless you ask literally anyone else.

Join me as we unpack the performative perfection of Christian influencer couples, one awkward YouTube thumbnail at a time. From purity culture to "God told me you're my spouse" vibes, this channel is for exvangelicals, curious skeptics, and anyone who’s ever side-eyed a relationship advice video that starts with "We waited until marriage..." 

New videos every week. Come for the cringe, stay for the healing. 

#exvangelical #paulandmorgan #deconstruction #fundiesnark #fundie

episodes.title: Dealing with Community Loss after Deconstruction
episodes.description:
Leaving a faith community can be incredibly difficult, not just because of shifting beliefs, but also due to the loss of relationships, support systems, and a shared sense of belonging. In this video, I talk about the emotional impact of community loss after deconstruction, how to navigate feelings of grief and loneliness, and ways to rebuild meaningful connections.

#deconstruction #faithjourney #exvangelical #exchristian

episodes.title: Paul & Morgan’s Repentance Video Is a MASTERCLASS in Manipulation | Exvangelical Reacts
episodes.description:
@PaulandMorgan's recent video was... disturbing, to say the least. What did you all think? 

Today we’re reacting to Paul & Morgan’s latest “I Need to Repent” video and… whew. The performative guilt. The emotional manipulation. The spiritual theatrics. If you’ve ever felt sick watching someone publicly weaponize repentance for views — same.

😬 Why does this feel more like a content strategy than an actual confession?
🎭 What even is repentance in evangelical circles? (Hint: it’s usually about control.)
📉 And why does this entire video feel like one giant red flag wrapped in a Bible verse?

As an exvangelical, I’m breaking it all down — the theology, the drama, and the ick factor. If you’ve been burned by public Christian influencers pretending to be humble while doubling down on toxic beliefs, you’re not alone.#paulandmorgan  #girldefined #exvangelical
